POS 3 15,7

DLG a
I'm not going anywhere without my mom.

DLG c
I traded my jacks for Steve's lunch. Now I can survive the winter if I take small bites.

DLG d
Sorry kids, I can't drive this bus in snow like this. You can wait here, or walk home.

DLG e
I heard there are bears past 43rd street. I'm not ready to die yet! I still need Harvey The Slugger Johnson for my baseball card collection!

DLG f
There aren't bears on 43rd you dummy. They're on 12th! I saw one... well, my cousin did anyway.

DLG g
*peck peck* I hear there hasn't been a winter like this since before the City was a city. But what do I know? I'm just a bird.

DLG h
Is someone sleeping in there? Better not disturb them.

DLG i
We used the instructions on this gum wrapper to bring our snowman to life! It follows our every command!

DLG j
We told the snowman to DO nothing and SAY nothing. No matter what! Hehehehe - it worked too!

DLG k
The snowman is motionless. It must be hard work to stay so still.

DLG l
Oh hey, it's Adele's kid! I know your mother is busy, but this is a big storm to walk home in. Take this matzoh ball soup with you - it's on me!

DLG m
The bear is concentrating on its tiles. He growls, thoughtfully.

DLG n
I may not see so well anymore, but I can still play Mah Jongg! My opponent is quite a tough customer.

DLG o
There are footsteps in the snow. The snowman is gone.

DLG p
Snow drifts down through the light of the streetlamp. You can hear the muffled sound of the traffic. The rest of the city seems far away.

DLG q
The books for the dress shop are still on the table. Mom must have just finished closing.

DLG r
You made it home! I knew you would be alright.

DLG s
It's too cold to keep walking that way. Better find somewhere to warm up.
